gurmukhi: swcu khoN sun lY icq dY ibnu dIn idAwl kI swm isDwey ]
transliteration: Saach(u) Kahon Soun Lai Chit Dai Bin(u) Din Diaal Koo Saam Sidhaae||
translation: Listen attentively, I speak Turth, Thou shalt not achieve the target without going under the Refuge of the LORD, Who is ever Merciful to the lowly.

gurmukhi: pRIiq kry pRBu pwXq hY kiRpwl n BIjq lwNf ktwey ]100]
transliteration: Prit(i) Dare Prabh(u) Paayat Hai Kridaal Na Bhoojat Laand Kataae||100||
translation: God can only be realized with LOVE, He is not pleased by circumcision.100.

gurmukhi: kwgd dIp sBY kir kY Aru swq smuMdRn kI msu kY hoN ]
transliteration: Kaagad Doop Sabhai Kar(i) Kai Ar(u) Saat Samudran Koo Mas(u) Kai Hon||
translation: If all the continents are transformed into paper and all the seven seas into ink;

gurmukhi: kwt bnwspqI sgrI ilKby hUM ky lyKn kwj bnY hoN ]
transliteration: Kaat Banaaspatoo Sagroo Likhbe Hoon Ke Lekhan Kaaj Banai Hon||
translation: By chopping all the vegetation the pen may be made for the sake of writing;

gurmukhi: swrsuqI bkqw kir kY juig koit gnys kY hwQ ilKY hoN ]
transliteration: Saarousoo Baktaa Kar(i) Kai Joug(i) Kottee Gades Kai Haath Likhai Hon||
translation: If the goddess Saraswati be made the speaker (of eulogies) and Ganesha be there to write with hands for millions of ages;

gurmukhi: kwl kiRpwl ibnw ibnqI n qaU qum kO pRBu nYk irJY hoN ]101]
transliteration: Kaal Kridaal Binaa Bintoo Na Taoo Toum Kau Prabh(u) Naik Rijhai Hon||101||
translation: Even then, O God! O sword-incannate KAL! Without supplication, none can make Thee pleased even a little.101.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk gRMQy sRI kwl jI kI ausqiq piRQm iDAwey sMpUrn suB msqu ]1] APjU ]
transliteration: It(i) Sri Bachitra Naatak Granthe Sroo Kaal Joo Koo Oustat(i) Pritham Dhiaae Sanpooran Soubh Mast(u)||1||afjoo||
translation: Here ends the First Chapter of BACHITTAR NATAK entitled The Eulogy of Sri KAL.â€™1.

gurmukhi: qumrI mihmw Apr Apwrw ] jw kw lihE n iknhUM pwrw ]
transliteration: Toumroo Mahimaa Apar Apaaraa|| Jaa Kaa Lahio Na Kinhoon Paaraa||
translation: O Lord! Thy Praise is Supreme and Infinite, none could comprehend its limits.

gurmukhi: dyv dyv rwjn ky rwjw ] dIn dieAwl grIb invwjw ]1]
transliteration: Dev Dev Raajan Ke Raajaa|| Doon Daiaal Gadib Nivaajaa||1||
translation: O God of gods and King of kings, the Merciful Lord of the lowly and protector of the humble.1.

gurmukhi: mUk aucrY swsqR Kt ipMgu igrn ciV jwie ]
transliteration: Moond Ouchrai Saastra Khat Ping(u) Giran Chad(i) Jaae||
translation: The dumb utters the six Shastras and the crippled climbs the mountain.
